TITLE: Peru's ousted President Castillo challenges detention
SUMMARY: Peru’s ousted President Pedro Castillo says he is being “unjustly and arbitrarly detained” and thanked his supporters for their “effort and fight” since he was taken into custody last week

TITLE: At least 100 people killed by floods in capital of Congo
SUMMARY: At least 100 people have been killed and dozens injured on Tuesday by widespread floods and landslides caused by heavy rains in Congo’s capital, Kinshasa

TITLE: Bodies of 27 migrants found in Chad desert, says UN group
SUMMARY: The International Organization for Migration says it is “shocked and saddened” by the discovery of the bodies of 27 migrants including four children in the Chadian desert

TITLE: 34 Haitians rescued from uninhabited Puerto Rico island
SUMMARY: The U.S. Coast Guard says it has rescued 34 Haitian migrants abandoned by smugglers on an uninhabited island near Puerto Rico

TITLE: 8 in France face verdict over Nice extremist truck attack
SUMMARY: A French court has convicted eight people charged in connection with a truck attack more than six years ago by an Islamic State sympathizer that killed 86 people celebrating Bastille Day in Nice

TITLE: 2 crashes in Nepal leave at least 29 dead, 22 injured
SUMMARY: A bus returning from a party crashed near the Nepalese capital killing at least 17 and injuring 22 more

TITLE: Sudan strikes deal with UAE firms for $6 billion port
SUMMARY: Sudan’s military government has signed a $6 billion preliminary agreement with two firms from the United Arab Emirates to construct a new port on the Red Sea coast

TITLE: Greece: Roma teenager shot during police chase dies
SUMMARY: Thousands of protesters have marched through the northern Greek city of Thessaloniki and the capital Athens, as Roma community leaders appeal for calm after the death of a Roma teenager

TITLE: Career diplomat appointed new Belarus foreign minister
SUMMARY: President Alexander Lukashenko of Belarus has appointed a career diplomat as foreign minister, succeeding an official whose death triggered speculation about foul play

TITLE: EU ministers fail again on gas price cap to contain costs
SUMMARY: European Union energy ministers have failed yet again to overcome their deep differences on a natural gas price cap that many hope would make utility bills cheaper so people can stay a little warmer during harsh winter days

TITLE: Mexico shuts down large migrant camp in the south
SUMMARY: The Mexican government has dismantled a massive migrant camp in the southern state of Oaxaca where tens of thousands migrants have cycled through to get temporary transit documents on their way to the United States border

TITLE: Vatican cardinal sues for defamation in Quebec assault claim
SUMMARY: A Vatican cardinal is suing a Canadian woman for defamation after she accused him of sexual assault while he was archbishop of Quebec

TITLE: Germany seeks quicker removal of extremists from military
SUMMARY: The German defense ministry has announced plans to make it easier to dismiss suspected extremists from the military without lengthy disciplinary proceedings

TITLE: Germany seeks quicker removal of extremists from military
SUMMARY: The German defense ministry has announced plans to make it easier to dismiss suspected extremists from the military without lengthy disciplinary proceedings

TITLE: Danish PM: After weeks of talks, deal on centrist govt
SUMMARY: Acting Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen says an agreement has been struck to form a new center-led government after 42 days of talks following the Nov. 1 general election

TITLE: Denmark's acting PM says agreement struck to form new center-led government after long talks, announcement within days
SUMMARY: Denmark's acting PM says agreement struck to form new center-led government after long talks, announcement within days

TITLE: US Navy hospital suspends care in Haiti after 19 overboard
SUMMARY: A U.S. Navy hospital ship docked in southwest Haiti has temporarily suspended medical services after 19 people with the mission fell overboard amid a heavy swell hitting the region

TITLE: Peru judge denies ousted leader Pedro Castillo's jail appeal
SUMMARY: A judge has ordered ousted Peruvian President Pedro Castillo to remain in custody, denying his appeal as authorities build a rebellion case against him

TITLE: Zelenskyy asks New Zealand to focus on war's ecological toll
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has urged New Zealand to take a leading role in focusing on the environmental destruction his country is suffering as a result of Russia’s invasion

TITLE: Mexican state loses third governor in a row
SUMMARY: The central Mexico state of Puebla has lost its third governor in a row, when Gov. Miguel Barbosa died Tuesday of unspecified causes
